Name: Cassandra LEROY
Review: We visited the A‚ÄôDAM Lookout tower as a group of 6 people, and overall the experience was nice, but quite expensive for what it is. Access and parking: We parked at the Q-Park at the central station, and paid ‚Ç¨47 for only 3 hours 11 minutes, which is clearly excessive. If you can find a free space on the streets of Amsterdam or use another means of transport, avoid this parking lot. From there, we walked to the free ferry (6 min walk). The ferries leave every 4 minutes and drop you off directly at the foot of the tower. Entrance and ascent to the tower: We had booked our tickets in advance (and we highly recommend doing so!). Entry was after a short 10-minute queue. A photo with a green background is offered to you, but it is optional. The elevator, fast and futuristic, propels you to the top in a few seconds, but be careful: it is full of flashes and light effects ‚Äì to be avoided by sensitive people (especially epileptics). Panorama & restaurant: Once at the top, the panoramic view of Amsterdam through the large floor-to-ceiling windows is truly beautiful. There is also a bar and restaurant on site. We took tickets with access to the restaurant, and even if the prices are a little high (tourism requires), the service was fast, the food decent, and the staff very friendly. Small downside: even having reserved for 6 (4+2), we were not able to eat all together, because they only have a table of 6... which was occupied by 4 people. The swing (Over The Edge): Access to the roof is via stairs. Up there, you have to add ‚Ç¨7 to ‚Ç¨7.50 to do the famous swing above the void. The experience is fun, but very short (around 1min30), and the wait can be long depending on the crowd. Remember to cover up well because it is very windy, and phones are prohibited in the swing (unless someone is filming you from outside or if you entrust it to the staff). You leave with a QR code to collect a souvenir photo with the A‚ÄôDAM Lookout watermark, which is nice. Photo tips: There are a lot of reflections in the windows, so to take good photos, remember to stick your phone against the window and discreetly move any ottomans or distracting items (and then put them back, of course). You can take photos almost anywhere, the space is quite free. Duration of the visit: We planned to stay 2.5 hours, but ended up staying almost 3.5 hours. It's better not to plan anything right afterward to be able to take full advantage of it. In summary: ‚Ä¢ Beautiful panoramic view ‚Ä¢ Nice restaurant but high prices ‚Ä¢ Fun swing but expensive for the duration ‚Ä¢ Good organization but lack of flexibility for groups ‚Ä¢ Original experience, but overall quite expensive: ‚Ç¨25 entry + restaurant + swing + parking = it goes up quickly! It‚Äôs an activity to do once for the view and the adrenaline of the swing, but to anticipate well in terms of budget and timing.
label: negative

Name: Anett Szrnka
Review:
The lookout is a restaurant, bar, giant swing and a lookout, all in one, and be prepared that you need to pay the price for each of these.

We went with a basic entry ticket, and were pleasantly surprised by the very accurate model of Amsterdam right upon entry - this is something we didn‚Äôt see anywhere else and it was nice to have a bird view on the city.

Then we took the elevator ride up, which came with an exciting laser show. (They warn you in advance that it is not recommended for people with epilepsy.)

At the top, the view is fascinating, and there are both looking glasses and photo shooting points, free to use. Unfortunately, the swing blocks a very nice part of the view, but it‚Äôs not taking away too much. You can easily get a good view on the city and understand it a bit better.

Both the restaurant and the bar looked really nice. If you visit, it may be a fun experience to dine in high.

Name: Marianne De Somviele
Review: Luxury lunch and breathtaking view at the A'DAM Tower - a unique Amsterdam experience! For a special family lunch we were looking for a unique location in Amsterdam, and the panoramic revolving restaurant of the A'DAM Tower turned out to be the perfect choice. From the moment we entered everything felt luxurious and stylish. The warm welcome, the elegant entrance and the lightning-fast glass elevator ‚Äì which changed color during the ride ‚Äì immediately made the experience special. Once at the top, we were guided to our table in the 360¬∞ rotating restaurant, where we had a different breathtaking view of Amsterdam each time we ate. This unique effect made our lunch extra special. The dishes were refined and prepared with care, and the highly trained service ‚Äì clearly trained at hotel school level ‚Äì provided excellent service. Everything was extremely professional and hospitable, which brought the culinary experience to a top level. After lunch we wanted to admire the city even closer. Since it was windy, we put on our windbreakers and went to the outside deck. Instead of the well-known 'Over The Edge' swing, we opted for a different perspective: climbing the Horse of Marken, an iconic work of art on the roof of the tower. With our binoculars we zoomed in on different parts of the city, which made for surprising discoveries and impressive panoramic views. The A'DAM Tower offers a unique combination of fine dining, luxury and adventure. Whether you are looking for a special lunch experience, a romantic dinner with a view, or a spectacular skyline experience, this iconic hotspot in Amsterdam is an absolute must-visit!
label: positive

Name: Ahmed Yousif
Review:
The A‚ÄôDAM Lookout Tower is an incredible place to visit in Amsterdam! The staff was friendly and welcoming, and the entire experience was well-organized.

One of the highlights was the elevator ride to the top, which featured an amazing light show that made the journey exciting. Once at the top, the panoramic view of Amsterdam was absolutely stunning‚Äîa perfect spot to take in the city‚Äôs beauty.

The VR experience was also a lot of fun, offering a short but thrilling perspective of Amsterdam‚Äôs history and landmarks. For those seeking a bit of adventure, the swing at the top of the tower provides an exhilarating experience with breathtaking views.

Overall, the atmosphere and variety of activities made this visit unforgettable. Highly recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam!

Name: tobi
Review: Were on the platform for the first weekend in January 2025. What was a bit annoying was that it only opened at 10:05 a.m. instead of 10 a.m. and that some cleaning was still going on, but I can ignore it. When you come in you are led to the elevator. Before you can see a miniature image of Amsterdam, which was beautifully done. The elevator is open at the top (glass pane and you can see a light installation), done cool. Before you take the last stairs to the platform, you have a dry, beautiful view of Amsterdam. There is a bar, a small cinema as well as the history of the building. Once at the top of the platform, there is seating, the view and the swings. We had booked the swings and were the first guests when there was light snow and 0 degrees. We did it anyway, but unfortunately the swinging was only very short, it felt like it only lasted 5 minutes instead of the specified length. It was a great attraction and although it paid well, it was still nice.

Finally there is the outdoor terrace where you can admire Amsterdam from above. We also did the swing (the swing) lasts about a minute but it is truly a wonderful experience The only flaw is that the photos that are taken have really crazy prices! They could also be included here‚Ä¶

Name: m m
Review: We have booked the ticket "A'DAM Lookout Ticket and voucher for lunch or dinner" online in advance for the early evening of December 30, 2024. The voucher amounts to ‚Ç¨20.00 and can be credited towards the meal. When we arrived at the entrance there was already a long queue. Our ticket gave us no advantage. We had to wait our turn. The time slot booked didn't matter. Unfortunately, progress was slow, as after check-in you have the opportunity to take a souvenir photo, which you can purchase later. When we finally got through the queue, we stood in front of the elevator that was supposed to take us to the viewing platform. In the elevator we were told that we should watch the "light show" in the elevator shaft (glass roof of the elevator). Well, what can you say - a few strips of light that wander up and down the shaft and no wow effect. When we finally reached the top, we had the feeling that we had arrived at the influencer training camp. The location was completely overcrowded and you found yourself in a crowd of photo fanatic young people. One had the impression that everything revolves around the perfect photo/video. We went to the restaurant relatively quickly and were seated at the window. The first positive note: the view is breathtaking. However, we didn't have a quiet moment during the meal. The restaurant area is accessible to everyone, which is why the photo fanatics were everywhere. Since we were sitting right by the window, they kept standing around our table and taking photos. It was horror. The food is at the fast food restaurant level and is therefore grossly overpriced. Some of the information on the menu does not correspond to the facts. The club sandwich is not brioche bread, but ordinary wheat toast bread (since I come from the bread nation, I can judge this very well). Finally, we enjoyed the view from the upper viewing platform (located outdoors) and then drove back down. We didn't use the swing because we had to book it separately and neither the weather nor the price appealed to us. However, I am of the opinion that the swing doesn't provide much of a thrill because you don't actually swing over the abyss like you do on the High Swing in Berlin. In summary, one can say: terrible ambience, below-average gastronomy with poor price/performance ratio and poor organization (influencers in the restaurant between the tables should be sent to the "generally accessible areas" by the staff).
label: negative

Name: M√≥nica Zunino
Review:
The most disappointing experience I have ever had at A‚ÄôDAM Lookout. First of all, the entrance fee is a total rip-off for what they offer. You expect a lot more for the price you pay, but what you get is not worth it. When we arrived at the restaurant for our lunch there was a sign saying ‚Äúplease wait to be seated‚Äù but after waiting 45 minutes in the restaurant, when it was finally our turn, we were informed that the restaurant is by reservation only. Why were we made to wait in the first place if the restaurant only took reservations and they never let us know?

The elevator ride was equally frustrating. They make you look up, supposedly to see a magnificent view, but instead you are greeted with a couple of stupid, poorly designed pictures that they call a ‚Äúlight show.‚Äù Overall, I left feeling completely ripped off and disappointed. I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a genuine experience.

Last but not least, upon entering the building, there is a complete lack of security control, which felt concerning and highly irresponsible.

Name: TURKI K
Review: A'DAM LOOKOUT is an observation deck with an unparalleled panoramic view of Amsterdam. You will see the historic center of the city, its vibrant port, the unique Dutch landscape, and discover the famous canals that belong to the UNESCO World Heritage List. A state-of-the-art interactive exhibition and a free audio tour about Amsterdam's history and culture complete the experience. A'DAM LOOKOUT is located on top of the A'DAM Tower in North Amsterdam. For the daredevils and thrill-seekers, get an adrenaline rush with Europe's highest swing "Over the Edge" and dangle 100 meters above the ground, back and forth over the edge of the tower with Amsterdam at your feet. Or take a ride on Amsterdam's Virtual Reality Ride, a unique virtual roller coaster through the city. Enjoy the unparalleled view of our capital while adrenaline flows through your veins.

Adams Outlook in Amsterdam is very useful, and the city is still in good condition. These are the Anne-Frank-Houses, which are located in the Grachten and outside the Rijksmuseum. Probieren Sie fresche Stroopwafels, erkunden Sie den Vondelpark und entspannen Sie in trendigen Caf√©s. Amsterdam is very happy with charm and beauty!

I think it's important to highlight the availability of another employee who even made a point of guiding us in Portuguese with great politeness and that was what in a way saved part of the experience, but the feeling that remains of the place is that it is not safe for women alone! Name: Rokas Siskauskas
Review:
A'DAM Lookout: Soaring Views and Thrilling Experiences
Perched atop the A'DAM Tower, the A'DAM Lookout offers unparalleled panoramic vistas of Amsterdam. Ascend to the 20th floor via a thrilling elevator ride adorned with a captivating light show, and prepare to be mesmerized by the city's unique blend of historic architecture, vibrant waterways, and modern energy.
Unforgettable Views and Thrills
The outdoor observation deck provides a 360-degree vantage point, capturing the city's beauty in all its glory. Whether you're gazing at the iconic Centraal Station, exploring the intricate canal network, or admiring the lively port, the views are simply breathtaking.
For the adrenaline seekers, the A'DAM Lookout offers an exhilarating experience: the Skyfall. This 200-meter-high swing allows you to soar above the city, plunging into the breathtaking void and experiencing a rush of pure exhilaration.
More Than Just a Viewpoint
The A'DAM Lookout is not just a scenic attraction; it's a multifaceted entertainment hub. The ground floor features a captivating VR experience, immersing you in the city's history and culture. The rooftop bar and restaurant, PLATE, provide a sophisticated setting to relax and savor delectable food and drinks while enjoying the stunning views.
A Must-Visit for Thrill-Seekers and View Enthusiasts
Whether you're seeking breathtaking views, thrilling experiences, or a unique way to immerse yourself in Amsterdam's vibrant atmosphere, the A'DAM Lookout is an absolute must-visit. It's a testament to the city's innovative spirit and offers a truly unforgettable experience.
label: positive

Review: The ferry crossing is free. The elevator shoots you up in about 20 seconds and it looks GREAT with the lighting. It's worth it! It is better to buy the swing online as it is cheaper than in person. 16.50 EUR for about 2 minutes is a fair price for this attraction, but it didn't bother me personally. That's probably because I know the swing in Berlin on Alex and have a comparison. The swing in Amsterdam is "solid" like at a fair, and the swing in Berlin is like it used to be at the playground, where I can still turn myself and have more options. But of course this is a matter of taste. The view is stunning and it was still a great experience! I'll be back. :-)

At the top, there are some gimmicky activities at additional cost like swings and VR experiences, plus a bar / restaurant that I did not try. Overall just not worth the price of admission. There are several ticket options, for those who don't like the 3D rollercoaster or even the "rocking chair", my suggestion is to buy the ticket + 1 drink, it will be cheaper than buying at the bar. Another tip is to go with time and stay until sunset, the places are in high demand, but if you have time, just wait until most people go to the rooftop, have a drink and go down. After sunset, there is a program with DJs who play at the house.

A‚ÄôDAM Lookout is a must-visit in Amsterdam! From the moment you arrive, the views are absolutely breathtaking ‚Äì you can see the entire city skyline, iconic canals, Central Station, and on clear days, even the countryside beyond.

The highlight? The Over the Edge swing! It‚Äôs exhilarating to soar 100 meters above the ground with Amsterdam at your feet. Definitely a thrill for anyone looking for a unique way to see the city. And after the swing, relaxing with a drink at the rooftop bar while enjoying the view is just perfect.

A‚ÄôDAM Lookout combines adventure and beauty, making it one of the top spots in Amsterdam. Highly recommend for anyone wanting amazing views and a bit of adrenaline!

Name: Noelia Bautista
Review:
I bought the tickets a month in advance, including the boat ride package, which I highly recommend. I was looking for boat tours, and when I found out they offered them, I didn‚Äôt hesitate. The boat was nice; covered and comfortable and the captain was excellent! He explained everything really well, with just the right amount of humor, helping us get to know the city while having a good laugh. They sell drinks on board; we got Heineken for ‚Ç¨8. The ride lasts about an hour and a half, which is just the right amount of time.

Afterward, we went up to the building, and it‚Äôs a great place to hang out. Unfortunately, I couldn‚Äôt enter the building before the boat and to go back for the swing, so I couldn‚Äôt stay long in the building. Once you leave the building, you can‚Äôt return.

The swing experience was fantastic! There were three of us, and I was lucky to go twice, once with each person. They took three pictures, which wasn‚Äôt quite enough for me, but it was still worth it. They don't let you take pictures while you are in line, so on the left side there is a point where you go up a few stairs and there they come out perfect! The building also has a small cinema, plenty of photo spots, restaurants, bars, and a great souvenir store!

To get to the building there is a ferry that is free and leaves from the Central.

Review: It‚Äôs very convenient to get there from Amsterdam Central, literally nearby there is a free ferry that will take you to the other side of the river, and from there to the right and after 100 meters there is a building with an observation deck. It‚Äôs better to buy tickets online; they were cheaper with us. Take photos for free after checking your tickets (if you don‚Äôt print photos on the way back, of course), two photos with different emotions and then go to the elevator, here you may need to wait quite a bit, after which the elevator will take you to the top floor in 20 seconds. Prepare your camera in advance, because when going to the top you can shoot a small and beautiful light video through the glass roof of the elevator. On the top floor you will have the first level with a panorama through the glass along the entire perimeter of the building, and another floor above (you need to climb the stairs, there will be an open area with additional podiums for photography. Also on this floor there is the highest swing in Europe, they are for a separate fee there is a fee and there is usually a queue for them. There are restaurants on these two floors. In the evening the view is amazing üòçüòçüòç I definitely recommend visiting!!!

Review: The viewing platform with restaurants is a wonderful opportunity to let your gaze wander over Amsterdam. The view over the center is not obstructed, so you can see very far. There are free binoculars on the roof terrace and the platform to look around. The ride to the viewing platform is accompanied by an entertaining light show in the elevator. The swing is a great experience. You shouldn't be afraid of heights and then you can enjoy the view of the city in a different way. Unfortunately it was a bit short at just under 10 minutes. Three photos and a video are created, which you can then buy as a package for just under ‚Ç¨30; a single purchase is almost not worth it. Otherwise you get the photos in low resolution and watermarks free of charge. The best way to reach the place is from the other side of the river/canal by ferry. Otherwise there is also a bus stop.

Name: Ma√Ølinh
Review: Like the other opinions, here we are much more mixed. We do not recommend against the experience but give an indication of the experience-time-price ratio. 18.5‚Ç¨ per adult on site. Briefly on site: a covered floor with 360 view + 360 terrace. A small cinema room is worth the detour for the explanatory section on Amsterdam. To justify the rating, we have no complaints about the breathtaking view but we consider that the price is exaggerated if we limit ourselves to the ‚Äúhigh view of Amsterdam‚Äù aspect for 45 minutes at most. For ‚Ç¨4 more you have access to the riches of the Rijksmuseum for several hours‚Ä¶ (The supervisory staff were at the top level, good humorüëåüèΩ)

There are restaurants and pubs locally and you can also visit the eye film and photography museum that are close by, there is also a hotel onsite so if you wanted a different kind of experience in Amsterdam you could happily just stay in this location and discover parts of Amsterdam that you probably wouldn't if you stayed in central Amsterdam, I would definitely recommend a visit it's a very interesting experience

We came to visit the A‚ÄôDAM Lookout today. Because we did not have a clear idea on what the experience entailed, we changed our minds about wanting to go. To be clear, we changed our minds before we even got the tickets from the front desk in which one of the employees, Erik, was helping us. When we asked for a refund, Erik asked us fill out a document where we put our name and email address. He said he will add the reason why we are asking for a refund. He then proceeded to tell us that he was not sure that we would get our money back which was frustrating and definitely not reassuring. We are really hoping that we will get our money back. When we asked to meet the manager, we were told they were not there.

update: we got a refund but this place doesn‚Äôt have good service

Name: JJ Sheridan
Review:
We visited the A'DAM while on holidays and it was a pretty enjoyable experience.

The views are spectacular and the swing was great fun to try out.

We relaxed and took our time while there. Besides the views and swing there is not much else to do.

We had lunch unnthe restaurant which was probably wasn't the best meal we had while visiting Amsterdam. The fries were old and had been cooked more than a couple of times so they were pretty dry and sad looking.

The chicken bites were cooked using thigh meat and were gelatinous. Even a family next to us remarked how theres were fatty.

The burgers were lacking flavour and seasoning. The onions had black soot from being either cooked over open flame.

Overall, the food let the experience down.

I would highly recommend visiting, maybe wait until later to get food somewhere else.

Review: We give full stars. We don't understand the time slot we booked either, because you still have to queue up and wait. But it wasn't that full for us so it wasn't that bad. The swinging is a super mega experience, but it only lasts 1 1/2 minutes from start to finish. Photos will be taken, just like at the entrance, and you can later download them free of charge using the QR code or, if you want, have them printed out at the exit for money. The view from the roof is amazing. So even without a swing, it's uniquely beautiful. There is no small bar with drinks and also a restaurant. We also took part in the VR experience, which was really exciting. If you've never done this before, get involved. The elevator ride up to the roof and back down is embellished with a light show. We booked a package on site (there are many offers) for (I think) ‚Ç¨30 per person. For such a unique experience, totally okay.

Name: Karim
Review: My visit to Amsterdam Lookout was nothing short of spectacular. The experience begins from the moment you step into the elevator. The elevator itself is an experience, with an impressive light show that prepares you for the breathtaking view that awaits you at the top. Once at the top you will be treated to a panoramic view of Amsterdam. The city unfolds beneath you in all its glory, with iconic sights such as the canals, the IJ and the historic buildings that adorn the skyline. This view is truly breathtaking and offers countless photo opportunities. One of the highlights of Amsterdam Lookout is without a doubt the Over The Edge swing. This gigantic swing on the edge of the building gives you an adrenaline rush as you swing over the edge of the building, with the city far below you. It's a sensational experience not to be missed if you like a bit of excitement. All in all, my visit to Amsterdam Lookout was unforgettable. It is a must-visit for tourists and locals alike who want to see their city from a new perspective. The combination of the light show in the elevator, the phenomenal view, the exciting swing and the delicious food makes this an experience you will not soon forget.

It is best to visit the tower in the morning or in the evening because it is much too warm there at lunchtime or in the afternoon. There isn‚Äôt a lot of seating up at the bar so don‚Äôt expect to be guaranteed a seat when you go up there. There is a bit to do while you‚Äôre up there but nothing that nudges this up to 5*.

I heard the light show in the lift on the way up and down is something special but I was left deflated, don‚Äôt have any expectations for it because I did and it didn‚Äôt live up to them.

This place is worth a visit but personally I would stick to Amsterdam at ground level.

Name: Alexandra Ny√≠r≈ë
Review: On Monday, April 21, 2025, around 19:00, I wanted to buy an online ticket on the website. I see that the tickets were sold at half the normal price. I put the tickets I wanted to buy into the basket, I already had them at the checkout, I entered my bank card details, but the purchase didn't go through for some reason. I tried several times and it didn't work. I went to the location (A'dam lookout), where the cashier told me that their system was not working, so it was not possible to pay online or on site. Then my bank account manager informed me that my bank card was suspended, because bank card fraudsters controlled the A'DAM LOOKOUT website that night, where they obtained my bank card details and wanted to take my money. I couldn't use my bank card from that moment on. I do not blame the company A'DAM LOOKOUT, but a security protection on the website against fraudsters would be recommended. Others should not run into this, which I did too, so that bank card data is stolen by phishers.

Name: J√∂rg Reichmann
Review: Another crowded hotspot in Amsterdam. We bought tickets on site. The lady was very stressed and probably didn't feel like it anymore. First we had to wait forever to get to the 1st floor and then another 45 minutes until we got to the elevator. The 10 second lift ride is quite expensive at ‚Ç¨18. Ultimately it is a viewing platform. The highlight: LEDs are incorporated into the elevator shaft and they light up alternately. There is a really great and interesting 360 degree view at the top. Another ‚Ç¨7.50 is charged for swinging, with long waiting times again. We refrained from doing this because there are more spectacular swings. Like everything in the tower, the BAR is very expensive. Coffee, Cola Zero 0.2 l, ginger ale 0.2 l and a mixed starter plate (4 mini spring rolls and 8 bitterballs) were charged at just under ‚Ç¨40. It's a special, nice place, but does everything always have to be so overpriced? There were still dishes lying around everywhere, you didn't know whether anyone was still sitting or not. At least the live music in the bar was super cool. Well, here is the topic of generating sales and profits as much as possible. Seen it once and then it's good. Of course, you can drink something too. If you're already there.

Name: Sam M
Review:
If you‚Äôre visiting Amsterdam and looking for a unique view of the city, A‚ÄôDAM Lookout is an absolute must. Located just across the IJ River (a quick free ferry ride from Central Station), this experience offers more than just a scenic view ‚Äî it‚Äôs part thrill, part architecture, and part atmosphere.

The observation deck gives you a 360-degree panoramic view of Amsterdam, and on a clear day, you can see everything from the historic city center to the modern buildings in the North. The glass walls and open-air areas give you the freedom to enjoy the view however you like ‚Äî take photos, grab a drink, or just soak in the skyline.

But the real adrenaline rush? That comes from ‚ÄúOver the Edge‚Äù, the giant swing that takes you over the edge of the rooftop ‚Äî literally. It‚Äôs not for the faint of heart, but it‚Äôs an unforgettable way to see the city, especially as your legs dangle high above the river. Even if you‚Äôre nervous, it‚Äôs over quickly and completely safe ‚Äî plus the staff are friendly and do a great job explaining everything.

Inside, the interactive exhibits give you a cool, tech-forward look at Amsterdam‚Äôs culture, history, and future. There‚Äôs also a bar and restaurant upstairs where you can grab a drink or bite with the view ‚Äî definitely try to time your visit around sunset if you can, it‚Äôs absolutely stunning.

The vibe at A‚ÄôDAM Lookout is fun, upbeat, and modern ‚Äî perfect for couples, families, or solo travelers. Whether you‚Äôre into photography, architecture, or just want a cool view with a bit of a thrill, this is one of the top attractions in the city.

Then we had dinner in the restaurant with a great view and sunset and the food was really delicious. Be sure to try the new cheesecake desserts on the menu. Both really tasty. Afterwards we could take pictures on the observation deck of the Amsterdam at night. Definitely worth a trip.

Name: Mike Nelhams
Review:
Positives:
The view from the swing and the roof is breathtaking! The A'DAM lookout tower has some excellent views. The place is kept-clean and the lifts etc are accessible, even if the swing is not. The magnifying periscopes are free to use and even blur household buildings, which is a nice feature. The lookout tower experience is free with the I AMsterdam program also.

Negatives:
The swing on the top is one-use and you get about 3-4 minutes. (Not 7 minutes as advertised). The entire process feels very capitalistic and targeted to getting every cent from you. Don't bother with the 'virtual tour', it's 1 minute long. 5/7 of the staff were extremely passive-aggressive. The photos are advertised as free, but they charge ‚Ç¨20 and watermark them. (You can crop them anyways if you want).

Name: Laura Grazia Spedalieri
Review: Visiting the A‚ÄôDAM Lookout was one of the most exciting and evocative experiences of my trip to Amsterdam. Access is free with the City Card, a great advantage for those who want to experience something unique without spending a fortune. The 360¬∞ view of the city is simply breathtaking: from the canals to the rooftops, passing through the IJ and beyond, every corner is worth a look. But the real jewel in the crown is undoubtedly the highest swing in Europe, where you are literally suspended in the void above the city. It is a perfect mix of adrenaline, fun and beauty: an absolute must! The atmosphere is lively and engaging: forget the classic soft lounge music. Here there is DJ music at full volume, lights and sensory vibrations that make the experience even more immersive. You almost feel like you are at a party‚Ä¶ 100 meters high! The free photo shoot included in the entrance is also very interesting. In addition to the classic photos with customizable backgrounds and the Amsterdam skyline, there are also real photos taken while you are on the swing, in motion, in the midst of the emotion. An authentic and fun memory to take home, included in the price. To complete it all there is a spacious panoramic bar, with a private area from which to enjoy the view in a more peaceful way, perhaps with a drink in hand. Modern, well-kept and perfectly organized. In short: a complete experience, which combines landscape, adrenaline and entertainment in one place. The A'DAM Lookout is much more than a lookout: it is a must-see if you are in Amsterdam. Highly recommended!

Name: Hicham HAMMAD
Review: The ‚ÄúOver the Edge‚Äù swing at the A‚ÄôDAM Lookout in Amsterdam is a must-see experience for thrill-seekers and those who love spectacular views. Suspended 100 meters above the ground, it literally propels you above the void, offering a breathtaking panorama of the entire city, its canals and the surrounding countryside. Access to the swing requires an additional 5 euros in addition to the entrance ticket to the tower, but the adrenaline rush and the unique view are well worth the investment. The attraction is very safe, accessible from 120 cm, and allows two or even three people to share this unforgettable moment per swing. The free ferry ride from Central Station adds a nice touch to the experience. A must-see in Amsterdam, perfect for immortalizing your visit with impressive photos and memorable memories.

Name: Jose Luis Mondrag√≥n

We visited A'DAM Lookout in Amsterdam with the whole family and booked our tickets in advance through Expedia. When we arrived, they took a photo of us and mentioned it could be downloaded for free ‚Äî unfortunately, that wasn‚Äôt true, which was the only disappointing part of the experience.

Name: ya ya
Review: A‚ÄôDAM Lookout is one of the attractions you can‚Äôt miss when you come to Amsterdam! Although I didn‚Äôt challenge the famous ‚ÄúOver the Edge‚Äù high-altitude swing this time (to be honest, watching others swing out has made me weak üòÖ), but just standing on the observation deck, the beauty of the entire city has already amazed me. Overlooking the canals, historical buildings and modern urban landscapes of Amsterdam from a high altitude, the atmosphere of vastness and tranquility is very unforgettable. If the weather is clear, the view is super good, and I really can‚Äôt help but take pictures all the time. The interior of the observation deck is also carefully designed. There are interactive exhibitions to understand the history and future development of Amsterdam. It is very interesting for people like me who like to understand the background of a city in depth. In addition, the atmosphere of the cafe upstairs is great. It is a good place to sit down and enjoy the beautiful scenery and relax for a while. Even if you don‚Äôt play on the swing, I still think it‚Äôs worth a visit. Recommended for travelers who want to appreciate Amsterdam from another angle and don‚Äôt necessarily want to challenge exciting facilities! Ps: Amsterdam Card can go up for free~ Swings are charged separately

Review: Such a fun spot to see Amsterdam from above! The view is super pretty ‚Äî you get a full look at the city and its charming streets. üé´And yes, there‚Äôs a giant swing at the top! If you want to try it, don‚Äôt forget to book in advance because it gets full fast. You can also buy your ticket online so you don‚Äôt have to wait in line at the entrance (highly recommend!). üç∑Honestly, it‚Äôs not a must-do, but it‚Äôs definitely a cool experience. There‚Äôs a caf√©/bar upstairs too, so you can grab a drink or snack. Most people stay for like 15‚Äì30 minutes, but if you‚Äôre with friends, it‚Äôs also a nice place to chill and chat for an hour or two. Very chill vibes! This is a great place to enjoy the beautiful scenery of Amsterdam! Looking down from a high place, the whole city and streetscape are super beautiful~ There is also a super exciting big swing on top. If you want to play, remember to make an appointment in advance, otherwise it is easy to get a seat. And tickets can be purchased online, so you don‚Äôt have to queue up to buy tickets on site (super convenient!). To be honest, this is not a must-see attraction, but if you want to experience a special scenery or atmosphere, it is still worth a visit. There are also places selling drinks and snacks on top. Most people stay for about 15 to 30 minutes, but if you come with friends, you can also order a little wine, chat and relax for an hour or two. The atmosphere is very good!

Name: –í–æ–≤–∞ –õ—É–∫–∞—à–µ–≤–∏—á - voL4eHok
Review:
A place that is simply not worth the money they ask for. If you pay ‚Ç¨16, all you get is an elevator ride to the top floor and access to the rooftop, which offers a decent view ‚Äî but since the building is located on the edge of the city, you won‚Äôt see anything truly beautiful. It‚Äôs just a distant panoramic view of the city, which would be fine if the price were lower. At least you also get access to a restaurant ‚Äî with overpriced food and tons of dirty tables that no one cleans for over 30 minutes.

But if you decide to buy the full package including the VR rollercoaster and the rooftop swing ‚Äî well, that‚Äôs also underwhelming. The VR quality is extremely outdated: the video resolution is very low, and the objects in the video look like they‚Äôre from the early 2000s. The ride mechanism itself, which simulates a real rollercoaster experience, actually works quite well. Unfortunately, on top of the poor video quality, the VR headset I got was dirty ‚Äî it looked like someone had wiped greasy fingers across the center of the lenses. I asked a staff member to clean it, but it didn‚Äôt help. In the end, I could only see clearly on the edges of the screen.

As for the swing ‚Äî it‚Äôs okay, but I personally didn‚Äôt get much of an adrenaline rush, since even at its highest point, you‚Äôre not that far off the edge of the building. The swing ride itself lasts around 30 seconds, which is very short.

But the cherry on top? They film you during the experience and then generously offer to sell you a 30-second video and 5 photos for ‚Ç¨30 ‚Äî seriously?! So you pay ‚Ç¨30 for the full ticket and get nothing of real value, and then they basically spit in your face and ask for another ‚Ç¨30 for something that should have been included.

I don‚Äôt understand how this place has so many positive reviews. It simply doesn‚Äôt deserve them. If everything ‚Äî including the photos ‚Äî was part of the ticket, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs okay, though still not great. But in reality, it‚Äôs just outrageous greed.

Name: Nicki Laursen
Review: Fantastic experience at A‚ÄôDAM Lookout ‚Äì both excitement and top-class views We had a really good experience at A‚ÄôDAM Lookout in Amsterdam. The place offers a completely unique combination of great views, adrenaline rush and a cozy atmosphere. We were greeted by smiling and helpful staff upon arrival, who made it easy to find our way around and feel welcome. The viewing platform is a huge experience in itself ‚Äì with panoramic views of all of Amsterdam and its characteristic cityscape. But the absolute highlight was undoubtedly the swing ‚ÄúOver The Edge‚Äù. It was both nerve-wracking and great fun to swing over the edge of the building ‚Äì an experience we will never forget and which we can highly recommend to anyone who is not afraid of heights! We also ate in the restaurant, where the food was ok ‚Äì nothing flashy, but fine for the price. The service there was really good, and the staff were both welcoming and efficient. The only small minus was the acoustics in the restaurant, which made it a bit difficult to have a quiet conversation, especially if there were many guests. All in all, it was a really good experience, and we would definitely recommend A‚ÄôDAM Lookout as a must-see if you visit Amsterdam. It is an experience that offers great views, fun activities and friendly service ‚Äì and something you can enjoy as a couple, family or friends.

I liked the swing, although I admit it might not be the right attraction for the more squeamish. The bar and restaurant on the lower floor also have good views and a good atmosphere. The only drawback I find is that the photos and videos taken during the experience are very expensive if you want them as a souvenir (plus, you have to buy the full photo package, not individual photos). I found it to be an entertaining and different experience.

The A‚ÄôDAM Swing is not just any swing ‚Äî it‚Äôs Europe‚Äôs highest! Perched on top of the A‚ÄôDAM Tower, this thrilling ride gives you a breathtaking view of Amsterdam from an unforgettable height.

Swinging out over the edge of the building with the city sprawled below you is both exhilarating and surreal. The views of the skyline, canals, and beyond are absolutely stunning ‚Äî a perfect mix of adrenaline and awe.

Whether you‚Äôre an adventure seeker or just want to try something totally unique, this experience is a must. Well-organized, safe, and incredibly memorable ‚Äî you‚Äôll be talking about it long after your trip ends!

Name: Traveling G's
Review:
Way up at the top of the A'dam Tower is the lookout and swing.  It didn't really cost much more for us to ride the swing so I decided that I'd wrap up my courage and give it a shot.

Before it was our time slot for the swing we had a couple cold beers in the restaurant.  Watching other people experience the Virtual Reality Amsterdam Ride...my wife decided to check it out.

Making it to the roof on such a cold winter afternoon...we were bundled up and could still feel that cold wind blowing.  Still wasn't too cold to keep us from getting some pictures or dissuade us from the swing.

I am not a fan of heights and was trepidatious to say the least.  When we got in and the swing was moving I was tense.  The view of the city and the entire area was where I kept my focus for the few minutes until we were back down. Much fun...I'd do it again but I'd still be a bit skeered.

Name: Cabey M
Review:
Bought my tickets before travelling - Swing and VR Rollercoaster. No wait time to get in, but I would recommend entry at least 30mins to an hour before your 15min swing window.

All floors had great views of the city, and there were two bars available to use a drink token, including the rooftop bar.

The VR rollercoaster is a lot of fun and would rec, though the headsets are slightly uncomfortable if you're a glasses wearer. Lasts around a minute but I enjoyed a lot.

Rooftop had a bar and unparalleled views of the city. Not a huge amount of seating, nor shade, but worth it.

The swing is good fun - Lasts around a minute also. I was doing well but my belly did definitely drop after one of the looks down!

Good gift shop on the ground floor with competitive prices for elsewhere in the city - also sold ice creams and cold water which was definitely appreciated because it was a HOT day.

Caught the FREE walk-on ferry from/to the Centraal Station, rrally easy and, once over the canal, the building is a short walk from the terminal. In Centraal station, follow signs for the ferry.

So we ordered a bottle of white and thought that we would enjoy the view there like what other customers before us did with the same table and chairs in the exact same location. However, one of the staff members came and told us that we were not allowed to sit where we were because that‚Äôs where people take pictures. I fully understand the rationale and respect that everyone should have the right to access the nice view. But it would be much better if there is clear sign to set the ‚Äòdo not sit here rule‚Äô so that people like us won‚Äôt feel that we are being treated differently compared to other customers. I spoke to the manager who was very friendly and I do hope that this constructive comment will be taken forward.

The restaurant was cozy, modern, and the service was easy with a QR ordering system. The views over the city were definitely the best part of the visit, and the food was a positive surprise. The music created a relaxed atmosphere without disturbing the conversation. The swing on the edge of the observation deck provided a nice adrenaline rush, and the additional fee was reasonable. The whole experience was well organized, but it is clearly a one-time experience. I recommend A‚ÄôDAM Lookout to first-time visitors and those looking for speed and views in the same package. There‚Äôs a free ferry that runs all day from near Amsterdam Central Station ‚Äî it only takes about five minutes to cross. We booked tickets for the A‚ÄôDAM Tower lookout, the swing, and the VR ride.

The VR experience was short but fun ‚Äî a virtual roller coaster that takes you soaring through the city of Amsterdam. It was a great extra to add to the package.

The view from the top of the tower is absolutely stunning. You can see all the iconic landmarks of Amsterdam. Be aware that the bar prices are quite high (as you‚Äôd expect), so I‚Äôd recommend bringing your own water. Still, it‚Äôs worth it for the atmosphere and the view. It wasn‚Äôt too crowded when we visited, which made the experience even better.

Now, the swing‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs incredible. The view while you‚Äôre swinging over the edge is unreal. The staff were super friendly ‚Äî although I was surprised by the number of Liverpool fans among them when they saw me in my Newcastle shirt! üòÇ

The swing itself lasts about 3‚Äì4 minutes, which feels a bit short but is pretty standard. Still, it‚Äôs a must-do. I‚Äôd 100% recommend this experience to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Best to book ahead ‚Äî we booked ours the same morning.

Name: Jen Darling
Review:
My post is written as someone with a  physical impairment and my review is therefore scored on accessibility.

I found A'dam lookout easy to find, there is a free ferry from the rear of Centraal Station which arrives regularly each way.

The lookout is about a 5 - 10 minute walk from the ferry: under 5 minutes for those able bodied.

There is a set of steps leading up to the entrance. Once you enter you queue up for tickets. I would say this is quite a pricey experience. Booking online saves you 2 euros and you can skip the first queue.
Due to my mobility needs, after I was directed to a flight of stairs I double checked with a member of staff whether there was another way up and was directed to a staff elevator. This took me to the first floor where I queued for my ticket to be scanned and then joined another queue to access the elevator to the top of the building.
There were no places to sit while waiting for the elevator.

Once in the elevator, due to the volume of people waiting, they cram as many people in there and this is very uncomfortable.

Once at the top, or what appears to be the top, there is a VR experience, a room with 2 tv's playing a long advert for the lookout. There are educational boards and a scale replica of the building.

There is a restaurant/bar, but all the tables and chairs are stool height and not catered to those with mobility issues. There is no other seating.
There are toilets, but these are up a set of steps.

Unfortunately the lift does not go up to the roof terrace and therefore there is a whole area you will miss out on if you cannot ascend/descend stairs. Which really should be stated before you handover money.

The journey back down is, again, a long queue with nowhere to sit, before being crammed into a lift and then arriving on the first floor with a guided path leading to a stair case.

Had I known that I wouldn't be able to access the full experience, I wouldn't have done it.

I think that the website could have detailed the accessibility a bit better to enable a visitor with mobility issues to make a more informed decision.
label: positive

Name: Marvin Born (Thebomcraft)
Review: The A'DAM Lookout is a spectacular observation deck on the roof of the former Shell tower building ‚Äì now A'DAM Toren ‚Äì in Amsterdam-Noord, directly opposite the central station. It can be easily reached in just five minutes by taking the free ferry from Central Station to Buiksloterweg. The visit begins with the elevator, which, with its light and sound effects, becomes a mini-club experience ‚Äì a great introduction to what's to come. Once at the top, you'll be treated to a 360¬∞ panoramic view: the historic city center, the canals, the harbor, and the typical Dutch polder landscape. A total of over 100 meters high ‚Äì ideal for photo opportunities around sunset. A special attraction is the "Over The Edge" swing, Europe's highest rooftop swing. You swing over the edge in front of the building ‚Äì approximately 60 seconds of thrills with a view over the city. Users describe the experience as exciting, but shorter than expected ‚Äì some see it more as an Instagram moment than a true adventure. Also available: a VR rollercoaster, interactive exhibition areas on Amsterdam's history and culture, and a revolving restaurant "Moon" ‚Äì ideal for drinks with a view. There are also comfortable seating areas such as lounge beanbags and a sky bar feel with a relaxed atmosphere. Tickets cost around ‚Ç¨15‚Äì17 depending on the option. Extras such as the swing or drinks carry an additional charge. Booking is recommended, especially during peak times or if you want to experience the swing. Amsterdam City Card holders often enjoy free admission; the swing costs extra. The entire visit usually takes 1‚Äì2 hours; those who want to use the restaurant or VR offerings should plan for up to 3‚Äì4 hours.
label: positive

Name: Emmy Akinlaja
Review:
Absolutely great experience. Everything we experienced was on point. From the lights and music in the lift, to the VR roller coaster experience, to the swing hanging off the building, to spots where you can take photos, to the bars and restaurants. Very lovely experience.

They have lockers were you can keep your items if necessary.

One thing that would have been great is if there was clarity on how many times you can go on the rides. The ticket says you can use it from 10am to 10pm, but you can only go on the rides once.

The time slots for the swing ride is also not set in stone. You can arrive earlier or later. Everyone goes on a queue.

I came with my wife and kids, 14 and 11, and they were fully engaged. There were younger kids there too who looked like they were having a great time.

It cost the 4 of us ‚Ç¨110. Cheaper tickets for kids and buying online saves you about ‚Ç¨3 on each ticket.

I would definitely recommend coming here if you are in Amsterdam.

The highlight is the "Over the Edge" swing ‚Äì you swing over the edge of the building at a height of 100 meters. A real adrenaline rush!

The view is spectacular ‚Äî you can see the canals, cruise ships, and the city skyline. However, the swing ride itself is very brief, lasting only 1‚Äì2 minutes. They do take photos during the ride and offer a free low-quality version or a high-quality one for 25 euros. If you want better memories without paying that price, bring someone to take photos for you.

Name: Its A Wonderful Life
Review:
A‚ÄôDAM Lookout ‚Äì An Architectural Curiosity with Limited Rewards

From the moment you spot it across the IJ River, the A‚ÄôDAM Lookout stands out with its striking, modern design ‚Äî a bold architectural statement that‚Äôs hard to miss. Unfortunately, for me, that was the most memorable part of the experience.

The day I visited, the skies opened up in a relentless downpour, making the outdoor observation deck inaccessible. Instead, I found myself on the indoor restaurant floor, gazing out over Amsterdam through rain-streaked glass. Yes, you do get a full 360¬∞ view of the city from up here, but truth be told, the most compelling sights of Amsterdam are best discovered at street level, where the city‚Äôs charm truly unfolds.

Thankfully, my visit was included with the I Amsterdam City Card. Had I paid the standard ticket price, I might have felt shortchanged. As an attraction, A‚ÄôDAM Lookout is a modern curiosity rather than a must-do ‚Äî one for architecture enthusiasts or those with a City Card in hand, but not a priority for a short itinerary.

Name: T K
Review: The A‚ÄôDAM Lookout in Amsterdam-Noord is a thrilling vantage point that delivers a sky-high perspective of the city‚Äôs iconic skyline. Just a breezy five-minute ferry ride from Central Station, free and fun, with IJ River views, this sleek tower is hard to miss, looming like a modern monolith beside the Eye Filmmuseum. The ‚Ç¨18.50 ticket (cheaper online) grants access to a 360¬∞ observation deck on the 20th floor, where Amsterdam‚Äôs canals, historic center, and distant polders unfold in a breathtaking panorama. The elevator ride, a 22-second blitz of pulsating lights and music, sets the mood for adventure. The ‚ÄúOver the Edge‚Äù swing (‚Ç¨7.50 extra) is the star for thrill seekers, dangling you 100 meters above the ground. It‚Äôs exhilarating, though the 60-second ride feels fleeting, and views are more industrial than Instagram-worthy. The VR rollercoaster adds a fun, if brief, digital dash through Amsterdam. The rooftop bar and Madam restaurant serve pricey but tasty drinks and meals with unbeatable vistas‚Äîbook ahead for dining. While the swing‚Äôs hype slightly outstrips its thrill, the deck‚Äôs views and vibe make it a lively must-do. Plan for 1‚Äì2 hours, ideally at sunset.
label: positive

Name: a
Review:
We visited A‚ÄôDAM Lookout during Sail 2025 and judging by the massive crowds, we weren‚Äôt the only ones with the brilliant idea to watch the event from above. Long lines to have your ticket scann and then again for the elevator. Before going up, there‚Äôs a greenscreen photo spot where you can pose on a steel beam high in the sky.

The elevator itself is impressively fast, with a spectacular light show projected inside the shaft. Your first stop is the indoor 360¬∞ observation deck. Here you‚Äôll find free telescopes, a bar with prices almost as high as the tower itself (‚Ç¨6 for a soft drink), and after visiting the toilet you can wash your hands with an unforgettable view. There‚Äôs also a scale model of the tower, an info panel about its facilities, and a small cinema showing an informative film about A‚ÄôDAM Tower.

Upstairs, the outdoor 360¬∞ viewing platform offers panoramas behind fences. Signs point out landmarks, buildings, and nearby cities. For fun photo ops, there‚Äôs a huge red horse and big A‚ÄôDAM letters.

On the way down, the elevator treats you to another light show before you exit through the souvenir shop, where the overpriced greenscreen photos are also available.

Getting to the tower is easy: the free ferry from Amsterdam Centraal takes just a few minutes and drops you nearby.
label: positive

Name: Lucy Parter
Review: Great experience! Definitely do the swing, great price for only ‚Ç¨7.50! Only thing is that the photos and video is quite expensive for what it is if you want to purchase
label: positive

Name: Wolfgang Hachmeister
Review: Beautiful location opposite Amsterdam Central Station. A ferry runs from the station to the building. Located on the right bank of the IJ (North Sea Canal). Great panoramic views ‚Äì open and closed decks ‚Äì over the river and the city, extending far into the countryside. Good explanations of what can be seen where, using maps and photos. Explanations of the history. Restaurants. A beautiful model of the city of Amsterdam is on the ground floor. A power elevator takes you up to the top.

Name: –Æ–ª–∏—è –ú–æ—Ä–æ–∑
Review: When you think about where to go in Amsterdam to feel above all those bustling tourists with selfie sticks, there is only one right place - Adam Lookout. Forget about canals, museums and other boring things. This is a place for those who are ready to conquer the heights and look at the world from above. Arriving here, you immediately understand: this is not just an observation deck, this is a kind of temple of strength and confidence. First, you go up on a high-speed elevator that literally shoots you into the sky. And when the doors open, you find yourself in a sanctuary, from where all of Amsterdam lies at your feet, like a submissive vassal. The view from here is just giga-high. You see everything: from the famous canals to the noisy train station, and it seems that the whole city is waiting for your instructions. And for the truly brave, there is an attraction called "Over The Edge". This is a swing that swings you right over the abyss! This is not for the weak, but for those who are ready to challenge gravity and their own pathetic cowardice. You sit, swing and understand that you are the king of the mountain, and no circumstances will break you. In short, if you are looking for a place to feel like a real giant who looks down on the small fuss from below, then Adam Lookout is your choice. It is worth coming here to prove to yourself and everyone around you that you are not just a tourist, but a conqueror of heights.
label: positive

Review: An incredible experience at the Amsterdam Lookout! From the elevator, the play of light immediately sets the mood and provides a unique taste of the city. Name: Marco Ruggeri
Review: A'Dam Lookout is one of Amsterdam's most fascinating attractions. From the observation deck, you can enjoy spectacular views of the entire city: the canals, the rooftops of the old town, and the bustling water traffic that crosses the canal, connecting Amsterdam North to the historic center. The entrance ticket costs ‚Ç¨25 and includes two drinks, a choice of soda, wine, or beer (note: cocktails are not included). For a small fee, you can try the adrenaline-pumping "Over The Edge" swing, which lets you swing suspended in the air, offering unforgettable thrills. The elegant and welcoming Sky Bar is also very pleasant, offering snacks and chips while admiring the view. The facility is easily accessible from Central Station with a free ferry that departs every 10 minutes until 10:00 PM. A perfect mix of views, relaxation, and fun: a stop that makes your trip to Amsterdam truly memorable.

A'DAM Lookout is a great place with an incredible 360¬∞ view of the entire city! The platform itself is impressive, but the real attraction is the "Over the Edge" swing ‚Äì a real adrenaline rush at a height of almost 100 meters. Despite its popularity, the organization of the entrance is very efficient. An adult ticket costs approximately ‚Ç¨16.50 (online), and the additional swing costs ‚Ç¨7.50 ‚Äì it's really worth it. Review: You can get to the observation deck without a queue, 360 panorama, beautiful view of Amsterdam even from the toilet, there is a sky bar. But if you want to get to the cable car on the roof, then definitely book in advance, then there is a chance to choose an hour and not have to wait. If you don't book in advance, then there is a long queue, we waited 1 hour and 20 minutes on a bad day. Of course, you can go up and spend this time in the bar, but if you don't plan on doing this, then it's better to book online. Here they will take photos and videos (riding on the swings) professionally and you can then download them to yourself via QR code. I won't say that this is the best pastime in Amsterdam, but if you are a fan of observation decks, then this is good. The location is right next to the station, very convenient.

The payment includes - a photo zone, a lift ride with a light show. Swing - 7.50 ‚Ç¨. It is worth it, because it is unforgettable: a spectacle and emotions!!!

Name: Dee Patel
Review:
Our visit to A‚ÄôDAM Lookout was one of the absolute highlights of our trip to Amsterdam! If you‚Äôre looking for a mix of breathtaking views, adrenaline-pumping fun, and a totally unique way to see the city, this is the place to be.

The panoramic view from the top is incredible ‚Äì you get a full 360¬∞ view of Amsterdam, including the historic city center, the IJ river, and beyond. Whether you go during the day to see the city come alive or at sunset for a golden skyline, it‚Äôs truly picture-perfect. Definitely bring your camera ‚Äì or better yet, just take it all in with your own eyes. It‚Äôs unforgettable.

Of course, we had to try the Over the Edge swing, and WOW what a rush! Swinging back and forth over the edge of the building, high above the city, was equal parts terrifying and thrilling (in the best way). It‚Äôs a must-do if you‚Äôre even slightly adventurous.

The elevator ride up was also fun fast and full of lights and music, setting the tone for the whole experience. The rooftop bar is a great spot to relax after the swing we enjoyed a drink while soaking in the views and atmosphere.

Everything was well organized, staff were super friendly, and the whole experience felt very smooth and safe.

A‚ÄôDAM Lookout is more than just a view it‚Äôs an experience. Fun, interactive, and totally worth it. Whether you‚Äôre a first-time visitor to Amsterdam or a local looking for a fresh perspective, this is a must-visit spot. Highly recommended!
label: positive

Name: Mirko Gerosa
Review: An outdoor terrace on the upper floor, with a swing overlooking the city, and an indoor observatory on the lower floor with a magnificent 360-degree view of Amsterdam. You can enjoy lunch or dinner right by the windows, with music and themed evenings.

After we were finally shown to a table, we were completely ignored, even though there was nothing else keeping the staff busy.
We eventually lost our patience and left without ordering. What made it worse was the attitude ‚Äì we felt looked down upon, and we noticed the same behavior towards other guests as well. This kind of service really leaves a negative impression and doesn‚Äôt make visitors feel welcome.

Wearing a VR headset and then zipping around Amsterdam is also a unique, hilarious experience. So, yeah, just do it! Friendly people, but yeah, students, I'm working and I'm going back to work mentality. Toilets are a bit of a problem, dirty. But the view with hands on was also an experience you won't soon forget.

Name: Pierre B.
Review: Absolutely incredible! This is a unique experience to do in Amsterdam. The view from the rooftop is breathtaking, but the real star is the Over The Edge swing. At first, you're a little apprehensive about swinging over the void, but the feeling is indescribable. It's a mix of pure adrenaline and vertigo, all while being completely safe. It feels like you're flying above the city, with its canals and miniature houses. The team is also super friendly and puts you at ease. An absolute must for those looking for thrills and an unforgettable panoramic view!
label: positive

Name: Deniz A C
Review: It's perched atop a tall tower, offering panoramic views of Amsterdam. For adrenaline seekers, it's a terrace with activities and a bar. An elevator with a light show accesses this 20th-floor terrace. With its 360-degree sky deck, a swing that lets you soar through the air at the edge of the 20th floor, and a rollercoaster that lets you experience virtual reality, it's ideal for thrill-seekers. The view is truly breathtaking. You can dine at the restaurant and have a drink at the bar. On the ground floor, you can take photos with various concepts. Photoshopped photos create adrenaline-pumping moments. There's also a shop at the exit where you can buy various souvenirs. You can print the photos you take at the entrance or receive them emailed to you for free. It's a must-see if you're short on time in Amsterdam. Free entry is available with the I am Amsterdam Card.

The free ferry connecting Amsterdam Central Station to the skyscraper is excellent. Inside, there are interactive installations and modern spaces that make the visit even more interesting, such as the virtual reality roller coaster. I recommend purchasing tickets online and going on a clear day to best enjoy the view.

We really enjoyed our visit to the lookout. Great views across the city. It was a beautiful spring day so we enjoyed a drink in the sunshine.

I imagine it could get quite busy up there at peak times but there was plenty of room on our visit. 

Like that they had free binoculars to see the view too.
label: positive

Name: laura
Review:
My friend and I had so much fun coming here!

The tower itself is really awesome and it was more informative than we thought! We were pleasantly surprised. The view was also amazing, even though the weather could‚Äôve been better.

The swing on the tower was the absolute highlight, it was the reason we even came. It was such a surreal feeling for the both of us, but in the best way possible. The rush of the air as you‚Äôre swinging over the edge - you can‚Äôt put a price on that, so if you‚Äôre coming to Amsterdam, definitely consider this gem. My friend and I both had a bag with us and were able to store them in a box beside the swing.

Bonus: Even the souvenir shop was quite nice and we found a little something for our friends and family there.
label: positive

Name: Valerie Mae W
Review: Teenager absolutely loved the swing experience and I had fun too! Gift shop was great and the staff was helpful and friendly!
label: positive

Name: Willem Johannes I
Review: At first it was a bit scary, but soon you got used to the situation and it was quite pleasant. Nice experience. Nice view.
label: positive

Name: paige stribley
Review: Loved everything about this experience, it‚Äôs something I‚Äôve wanted to do for a while and I throughly enjoyed it only thing I could change would be to make the actual swing time longer but I understand it is limited to ensure everyone has a turn and keep the queue down. The tickets we bought through GYG weren‚Äôt actually tickets for the swing it was entry ticket and 2 free drinks but still was cheap to pay for the actual swing experience. It was a great day during our swing so we had a great view of Amsterdam. The lift up to the bar and swing is a LED light experience which was great too.
label: positive

Name: @acoupleflights
Review: So happy we visited. Scary swing ride but well worth it for the views. Great photos included and purchased video was worth it for memories. Ferry from central station across the water was easy and free. Great bar both inside and outside of lookout.
label: positive

Name: barmonkey
Review:
Great, fun place. Enjoyed the swing and the 3d ride. Drinks reasonably priced in the bar. 
Nice that it‚Äôs a free ferry from the railway station
label: positive

Name: Things Helen Loves
Review:
A great experience. We booked online the day before for Lookout entry with the 'Over the Edge' swing experience. Staff were very friendly and welcoming with great up beat energy. 

After taking in views and riding the swing, we went to the Sky Bar. Very friendly, clean and prices about average for a big city. Tip: even you drop in, go to the toilets. It's a loo with a view!

The whole experience was a lot of fun and good value for money. Would recommend and would visit again if back in the city.
label: positive

Name: Imayid
Review:
Bought the package ticket which includes, entry to tower, the swing, and the VR ride. about ¬£25 if you buy online, I paid while standing outside waiting to go in and saved a few quid with plenty of booking times available for the swing, but may not be a good option if its busy.
The views are fantastic, with free to use telescopes and diagrams so you know where your looking, the swing is great although a little scary, the VR ride also really good although made me feel a bit rough when I got off. Prices at the bar are a bit expensive but in line with most places in Amsterdam. Staff were all friendly and helpful. there are photos and videos taken when on the swing which you can buy should you wish to.
Easy to get to just take the free ferry from behind central station
label: positive

Name: Abamagal
Review: Nice view of Amsterdam from the rooftop. We stopped in because we had the Amsterdam Card and were next door at This is Holland. We enjoyed the view. It is included in the Amsterdam Card so totally worth the visit.
label: positive

Name: Studio Suzanne R
Review: Nice, especially the swing. Too bad you couldn't download the photos in any way. Trying different browsers. Taking a single photo didn't work. With 'buy photo' you could only buy the whole package, but that button didn't work either. Tried to email the picture to myself, but then I got the message 'ivalid data'. Very unfortunate, because I would have liked them.
label: negative

Name: Claudia 3
Review: Definitely an attraction that allows you to have a beautiful view of Amsterdam from the other side. Honestly the price is not worth the experience. Not so much for the swing which costs 7.50 euros per person, but for the fact that you also pay for access to the structure. We did not pay because I had the Amsterdam City Card, otherwise the cost would have been ‚Ç¨ 16.50 per person plus the cost of the swing. Frankly too high for 30 seconds of vacuum swinging. If I'd known sooner, and I hadn't gotten excited, I wouldn't have gone. Very similar to a well-thought-out tourist trap. Appreciable the tribute of the three photographs taken by the staff while on the swing.
label: positive

Name: Bobby
Review:
Amazing experience. Fantastic views, great exhibitions and food. Good definitely do it again. Would give 5, but
 the bathroom was shockingly disgusting.
label: positive

Name: Deanna
Review: On our last night in Amsterdam my friends and I got tickets to go up to the A'dam Lookout and I got a ticket to go on the swing. It is a short swing - maybe a minute total - but the views are great and the chair etc feels solid. Definitely worth going on at least once to experience it. Make sure someone is off to the side to capture photos and videos of you on the swing, especially if they can get the "Amsterdam" written on the roof of the Central Station in the photo.
label: positive

Name: Mark Mairs
Review:
Booked for myself and partner in Feb 2025. Get the free ferry across, near Adam Central station. This takes about 5 mins and they run all day. 
We booked the Tower lookout, swing and the VR ride. The VR ride was just OK, doesn't last too long and it is a roller-coaster that takes you around the city of Amsterdam. It was a nice addition to the booking.
The view from the top is stunning. you can see all the famous places of Amsterdam whilst enjoying a cold beer. The prices at the bar 0 probably to be expected - are very expensive, however well worth it when you are enjoying the view. It was not too busy when we went as was out of season, however, I could imagine this being extremely busy in the summer. 
It was interesting watching the video on the towers history (located on top floor before the swing). 
They do have a restaurant, however, I think you may have to book and it did seem to be very expensive. 
The swing itself is amazing. The view was unreal and staff were very helpful. It only lasts around 3-4 mins though which was short enough, but again, to be expected. Would 100% recommend this to anyone travelling to Dam and its something that we would actually to again if we visit in the future.
label: positive

Name: Jules
Review: Great thrilling ride and spectacular views. Felt very safe on swing. We also had a glass of wine included in our ticket - was lovely sitting by the window admiring the views of the city.
label: positive

Name: Lou-Lou
Review: This was such a unique experience ‚Äî enjoyed by the entire family. Loved exploring the body as all of our senses were engaged. Would definitely go back!
label: positive

Name: 136ohanjan
Review: Such a beautiful setting. 5 ladies who lunch spent several happy hours in the bar with drinks and snacks, then up to roof terrace. Fabulous afternoon. Views breathtaking in the sunshine
label: positive

Name: Aimee
Review: An amazing experience!! We booked online in advance. ‚Ç¨16.50 each to go up the tower, then an extra ‚Ç¨7.50 each to go on the swing. Staff inside were really friendly. Cool elevator ride up to the top. Gift shop at the bottom. Drinks at the top are expensive. However, there are plenty of photo opportunities throughout, especially on the swing. All these photos taken of you are free! This was great because everyone gets photos from the swing which was an amazing experience to have photos of. The ferry over from Amsterdam Centraal station was free too. We were lucky we visited on a sunny day, the sky was clear so there were great views from the top!
label: positive

Name: HanKelly
Review:
A‚ÄôDAM Lookout was absolutely worth it! The panoramic views of Amsterdam were stunning from every angle, and the entire experience was well worth the $82.22 we spent for admission. The highlight was definitely the Over the Edge swing, which gave an exhilarating thrill while offering some of the best views of the city. Even the kids had a blast, taking turns on the swing and soaking in the scenery from the observation deck.

Inside, the interactive exhibits and viewing binoculars kept everyone engaged, and we also picked up some great souvenirs from the gift shop, adding an extra $25.40 to the experience. It‚Äôs a fantastic way to see Amsterdam from above, and we‚Äôd highly recommend it to anyone looking for a mix of adrenaline and breathtaking sights
label: positive

Name: lucyemma
Review: The lookout (without the Over the Edge experience) is in my opinion, overpriced. The cost to just get to the roof is a lot, especially as the view isn't spectacular, it's just Amsterdam which isn't a very iconic skyline. I try not to be pessimistic and look for the silver lining, but the cost to go up is too much. Yes - the elevator ride is a bit fun, yes there are food and drink options, and of course the swing, but those are all extras to an initial too-high price. If they bring the entry price down, it'd be more compatible with the level of the experience.
label: neutral

Name: Charlie L
Review: The A‚Äôdam tower is situated across the river from the Amsterdam Central station, a quick free 5 minute ferry away. The tower is 328 feet high and offers the chance to sit on a swing and be swung over the edge of the building. We did this in an attempt to face my fears and I have to admit I thoroughly enjoyed it. The tickets were reasonable and the roof top offered panoramic views of the city and surrounding area. There‚Äôs a bar and some artwork on the top to enjoy, including a red horse you can sit on. Overall a great experience and well worth a visit, especially at sunset like we did.
label: positive

Name: Lucy M
Review:
This was a great experience - you can reach it by travelling on the free ferry from Central Station and it takes you right to the door.  You can view a miniature village of Amsterdam - which is a great attraction in the entrance lobby! 

We then took the lift right to the top and were subject to an amazing light show on the way up! 

Up on the roof you get to see the most amazing views over all of Amsterdam and the opportunity for some great photos!

We also did the VR Ride - which was fantastic and the highest swing in Europe - which is also amazing but not for the faint hearted!

All in all - worth the money and a great time out!
label: positive

Name: Dorcas U
Review: The views were amazing and I loved the VR experience and the swing also but I have an issue that the staff said the pictures were free but I want ti get my pictures now and I‚Äôm seeing I have ti pay for them, an amount almost equal to the amount I paid for the whole experience
label: positive

Name: Aurore B
Review:
Table reserved for an evening meal. 5 minutes ferry crossing for free. 
You have to go up to the first floor where you have the opportunity to make 2 photos that you can download for free it even makes 2 small downloadable films.
Set right in front of the bay with views of all amsterdam. Sound and light atmosphere a small corner where you can swoop, trendy and festive atmosphere.
Very small menu but well served burger and service with a smile
label: positive

Name: Claudia S
Review:
The light show in the elevator is a nice idea and the view from the platform is just great.
Also the bar is very welcoming. From here you can enjoy the view further in peace.
Price vs. Performance is fully ok for us here.
label: positive

Name: Sas√† G
Review: A beautiful experience .. to try absolutely. A unique and indescribable emotion, I recommend doing this little experience at all.
label: positive

Name: Michael B
Review:

5D roller coaster VR

Kino

uvm.

Name: lamees s
Review:
It was an amazing experiance
But  iam not satisfied with the experience of buying the video that was filmed for us, it is not full version like they wrote .
label: negative

Name: Emanuelenaples84
Review: Unforgettable experience for both us and our children of 8 and 14 years making the swing was scary but feasible gives you an adrenaline charge tickets for the swing cost 7.50‚Ç¨ and you can do the same above the video you can buy online at 12.50‚Ç¨
label: positive

Name: Martina M

Name: Yael

label: positive

Name: Lenny R
Review: Was a very nice visit even if it rained. The elevator is really great and the food/drink too. Only recommended is
label: positive

Name: Victoria Alabi
Review: We visited Adam‚Äôs lookout on our trip to Amsterdam and we thoroughly had a good time. Every section was worth the experience, the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I greatly recommend for any visit to Amsterdam.
label: positive

Name: Emily Forrester
Review: We visited this recently & felt it was a nice thing to do when visiting Amsterdam for the first time. It wasn‚Äôt a full day experience which meant we had the rest of the day to explore. The swing & VR were both good alongside friendly staff. Would reccomend.

Name: Lyn T
Review: Good wine, good views good VR experience. Very helpful and friendly staff. Worth doing! You will get great photos here too.

Name: Grace S

Name: Yezdan F

label: positive

Name: Pumpkin
Review: The view itself is incredible and the bar/restaurant area is great and a 360¬∞c view around the building. We booked the swing at the top and it was slightly underwhelming and only lasted 1 minute. Quite expensive just for entrance and a one minute swing
label: neutral

Name: Sam Slieva
Review: You can‚Äôt miss the experience of climbing on the rooftop of the A‚Äôdam Tower, nice view is not spectacular like other cities as Amsterdam is a horizontal city; but I loved the history of the music tower, the swing, the bar, the VR experience, and the elevator with karaoke. Sube !! You won't regret it
label: positive

Name: Leidianapsilveira
Review: A nice place to go with friends and family. I really recommend it. I hope I have a chance to back in the summer as well.
label: positive

Name: Vy H.
Review:
Was it worth $20 USD?  Not really.  Bought our tickets onsite but I think it‚Äôs a bit cheaper if you buy online ahead.  But it was still nice to be up so high and see a 360 degree view of the city.  The outside observatory deck is skewed with an ugly fence so you can‚Äôt take great photos without your view being blocked.  The swing is a neat experience if you‚Äôre willing to pay extra but the swing isn‚Äôt much of a far push outward.

There‚Äôs an indoor bar/restaurant below, if you want to grab drinks and get a good 360 degrees view (clear windows).  Service at the bar needs improvement, they are not very attentive at all.  Cocktails were just okay.  Got a side of Parmesan Fries which were good.
label: neutral

Name: Dinothedog65
Review: Opted for the entry with two drinks.  As it was a morning visit we had coffees which were nice.  Unfortunately it was very misty that morning but we waited a while and it cleared a little.
