It was only for 2 or 3 minutes but it was good.  Paid for photos (not cheap) but videos were very short. All things considered visit was ok but it was very expensive for what you get.
label: negative

Name: Lynsey T
Review: This was a nice thing to do but very overpriced. We got the burgers included in the price of the tickets. Even though the food was tasty it was very difficult to find a table, staff were unhelpful and for a family it was hard work. My husband and son enjoyed the swing.
label: neutral

Name: Montaser F
Review: My experience at Madam Amsterdam was disappointing. The service was slow and unprofessional, with staff members seeming uninterested in providing good service. The food was far below expectations, lacking in flavor and presentation. To top it off, the ambiance was uncomfortable, making it a place I would not recommend. Additionally, I was told at the downstairs reception that I could place my order at the upstairs restaurant, but upon arriving upstairs, I was informed that I should have ordered downstairs. This added to the overall frustrating experience.
label: negative

Name: Millie G
Review: Overall we had a good time. It was nice seeing the views and was a pleasant change to have the use of the interactive telescopes for free. Staff were lovely. We did the swing over the edge which was good fun. They do take photos (which you can buy) but we asked a member of the public to take photos of us on our phone for free and the staff were happy with that. Drinks and food VERY expensive so we didn‚Äôt end up getting anything
label: neutral

Name: SomersetKeithers
Review:
It's worth the ticket, just for the view from the observation deck or Sky Bar. A couple of our party did the 'Over The Edge', fair play to them, not for me, at that height!!!
The free drink was a small Heineken(only beer available)/wine/coffee or soft drink, either of the deck or bar.
The fun photo, in front of a green screen,on the ground floor after entry, was a laugh before the lift ride to the top.
We did stay for another drink in the Sky Bar after our free one, on the roof. But due to the limited choice and price, we decided to move on.
It was a clear day,thankfully, so it was all about the Amsterdam skyline.
label: neutral

Name: 440mokhtari

label: positive

Name: Lisa w

label: positive

Name: Seaside65781090554
Review:
Drastically fantastic. I died and came back to life in seconds. Just getting to see Amsterdam above was one of the best things I've ever seen.
I couldn't ask for better.
Certainly to repeat when returning to Amsterdam.

üáµüáπ
label: positive

Name: Nicolette‚ú®
Review: My first visit was a pleasant experience. The views were stunning, and the attention to detail, particularly the ability to observe every part through the telescope, was impressive. However, the only drawback was that the staff appeared somewhat disengaged, which affected the overall atmosphere. While I don‚Äôt intend to be harsh, this was the impression we received
label: positive

Name: Pamela R
Review:
Lovely building with superb views.
There is a lookout swing for the super brave!  Just not for me.
Coupled this visit with a meal in the revolving restaurant.  Although this was quite pricey it was a great experience and the food was delicious.
The restaurant staff were very friendly and a nice touch is little hor  d‚Äôoeuvres (free) followed by little chocolates treats after dinner.
Recommended
label: positive

Name: Sukhy S
Review: This is a review regarding the Look Out Restaurant, Amsterdam. I ordered drinks and fries at 18:07 and after 5 minutes our drinks arrived. After another 10 minutes the fries arrived, cold and burnt. No cutlery or condiments. We told the waitress we had already finished our drinks and asked for replacements as compensation. The drinks never arrived and no apology was made! Absolute disgrace!
label: negative

Name: Sandra C
Review: A great experience. 8 of us went 3 adults 3 teens and 2 10 year olds and everyone enjoyed it and had fun. It's for all ages and well worth the money.

Name: iliatha

Name: Eva B

label: neutral

Name: NLK
Review:

An amazing time on the swing, when I could open my eyes üòÇ terrified of heights, but still absolutely loved the experience!

I would definitely visit again in Amsterdam.

Name: spkal5

Name: Darcy B

Name: H8840WUmarkc

The views from the top of here are amazing well worth a visit they have mounted binoculars so you can look around the whole of Amsterdam brilliant and the swing is cheap too at the time I went it was around ‚Ç¨25 for entry to the tower and the swing great experience would highly recommend a visit.

Name: Briana C

So good!

Name: Tiffany

label: positive

Name: sanchezdeclan

Name: Maha G

Name: denise7ramirez

Name: Lulu H

Name: jami7739

Name: Nathan F
Review:

Name: Amira B

label: positive

Name: Flyer55571131637

label: positive

Name: d_p_1321

label: positive

Name: Jlc
Review: Went to the A‚Äôdam tower in Amsterdam. Had a great time! Great views! Bought the Burger dinner and lookout tower combo ticket. Thought we would be sitting in the revolving restaurant but that was not the case. I thought the revolving restaurant would be fun to go to, but still liked the tower experience.
label: positive

Name: Vivian Akinyi
Review:
I booked for it while still in my home country Kenya and the booking process was quite seamless. I got all the confirmations I needed which gave me peace of mind.

We has a fun intro activity, having our photos taken before proceeding to the roof top which I found to be pretty cool.

Dinner was good, with great service. The food portions I must admit were a bit small but the drinks were great! The DJ did an amazing job with a dynamic array of music selections from different continents so I felt right at home when Amapiano was on :)

I would love to go back soon to experience "This is Holland."
label: positive

Name: Alejandro0203
Review: This place promotes it as something unique and it really isn't. It is a building of about 20 stories and upstairs has a hammock that when you climb you only see the sky. The only good thing is that there are good views of all Amsterdam
label: negative

Name: Gintarƒó
Review: I would say it‚Äôs a bit expensive but I guess worth visiting, especially if you also take the swing. Pretty good view! :)))
label: positive

Name: Laurence T
Review: An Attraction not to be missed! Very short 1m30 to 2minutes max but very nice with a breathtaking view of the city of Amsterdam, whaouu pictures taken by the staff pdt the Attraction then for sale on paper or free download via the given QR code. A good organization and with very little expectation as soon as the Reservation is made in advance on the Adam Tower site to ensure space and therefore a time slot chosen to be at the rendezvous at the top of the Tower. One swings with the Impression of paragliding and no Impression of terrifying free fall. Very nice. To do!
label: positive

Name: Tom P
Review: A fantastic view and great location. We were here in the evening and experienced a great sunset. The bar offers classic standard drinks. The elevator is also an experience. The swing was brave. We just didn't dare. Definitely a Recommendation
label: positive

Name: Annie V
Review: Awesome view.  Swing very worthwhile for the price.  Beautiful view.  I am afraid of heights but I dared, think it is great for anyone who is not afraid of heights!
label: positive

Name: GF
Review:
Came here and experienced the following:

The Lookout: Views were great and going up in the elevator with the lighting was a nice touch. On the top floor, the views were even better having a great overview of the city.

Over The Edge Swing: Once in a lifetime experience and thoroughly enjoyed this time in the air. Swing lasted for a few minutes whilst swinging back and forth off the top of the building.

Burger Menu: Ordered the Veggie Burger with fries. Had a decent taste and was filling.
label: positive

Name: Charis C
Review: Easy accessible from the central train station with the free ferry. Amassing 360 views of Amsterdam especially with good weather. I assume the views during sunset hours would be even netter than the morning ones. The swing is a very nice experience not to be missed. It is not as ‚Äúscary‚Äù as it looks and deserves to give a go. Queues for the swing are not long early in the morning and if you go there for this purpose try to be there early. The VR rollecestor is also fun but not something unique. Apart   from the roof top bar there is an indoor cafe that offers table sitting where you can enjoy your drink before you return to the ground! A different experience one should try!
label: positive

Name: TheQ47
Review: Great view as soon as you exit the lift, straight out over the city. The staff were all very friendly, and helpful, and the drinks in the bar were good, if a little costly. The swing was good fun, just a note, your allocated time is when you should join the queue, but it could take a long time to wait for the 2-minute swing, around 20-25 mins wait for us. The views from there are great though.
label: positive

Name: Companion08192237670
Review:
We got the bundle of the view+swing+VR rollercoaster.
If your'e in the area it's totally worth getting to the rooftop for the views of Amsterdam, but don't waste your money on any of their "extras".
I was excited for the VR experience they propagate so much, but not impressed. At all.
There were no people in the queue for the VR, yet I had to let the two staff members who were talking to eachother know that I'm standing there, looking at them, to get their attention and to do their job. The seat at my VR capsule was flat, uncomfortable and one of the armrests had been damaged and made my elbow hurt. Not to mention the VR experience being FAR from amazing, and it lasted around a minute. Not worth the money.
At the rooftop, we got on the swing which swings you above the skyline of Amsterdam, once again, lasted very short, not worth the money. They have a big "no photos" notice all around the attraction, to prevent you from taking your own pictures, of course, because they take them for you and very generously offer you to PURCHASE them at their website. Don't worry, because if you follow the QR code on your photopass, you can just take a screenshot of your photos, without paying a dime.
Once again,   not. worth. your. money.
The view is nice tho.
label: negative

Name: Bill R
Review: Forgettable experience. The $16.50 is an elevator ride in a not very tall building.  Everything else is extra and overpriced. The views are so-so, I‚Äôve seen better city views in free to walk up church towers.  This is nothing more than a tourist trap. All the positive reviews are advertising bots.
label: negative

Name: Pvb
Review:
Nice view over Amsterdam Centre. 
Con: waiting a long time for the drinks to be delivered.
Otherwise it was quite pleasant.
label: positive

Name: John M
Review: Loved the swing experience.. not a huge fan of heights but thought I would give this ago.. it took a minute or so and than just enjoyed the swing an an amazing views
label: positive

Name: Blanca P
Review: It is very expensive for what it offers, an adult and a 14-year-old girl for 54 euros... I do not recommend it, it is not so much: climb in an elevator with very fast lights, panoramic view and 3 minutes of swing. Anyway, it's all made up to get money out of the tourist.
label: negative

Name: openyoureyes369
Review:
A great place to look over Adamsterdam.  Just few minutes away across the harbour from Central Railway Station.  You can take the free ride ferry in 2 minutes time.

Besides the roof top lookout, you can also try the VR ride and the most importantly, the swing that located on roof top.  you are halfway swing out of the building surrounded by great view of Adamsterdam.

You should pick the perfect time to see sunset here.  Very relaxing
label: positive

Name: Duncan35a
Review: Worth the trip over the water for. From the lift with the lights to the swing over the edge it‚Äôs a must do. Great views of Amsterdam and a lovely wee bar just down stairs with again fantastic views.
label: positive

Name: Quin
Review: Absolutely amazing experience! Went with my friends and received amazing service, beautiful views and free photography and magnets! Brilliant morning in amsterdam for only ‚Ç¨24 per person!
label: positive

Name: Vivien Ewing
Review: We went up with my husband to have a drink and go on the swing, we got exactly what we payed for! I have some really cool pics and we had a good time trying the swing out.
label: positive

Name: Amani B
Review: It is fun and original but I found the price a bit too much, especially that most of the activities there are paid for separately.  You can take free shots but you need to pay 25 euros to download them. You need to pay 7 dollars for the swing and another 8 for the video experience. The staff is fun and welcoming and it has a nice bar, although the prices too are expensive there. I think you should consider your pricing. Thank you.
label: neutral

Name: Karen S
Review: The weather was beautiful, the company fine and the view breathtaking. The swing is super fun to do. We then had a nice dinner there and spent the evening with cozy drinks on the sky deck. Highly recommended!
label: positive

Name: Hocico
Review: Of course a fantastic view from this lookout - and I was also very lucky with the weather. The building also makes a very nice impression. Worth a visit.
label: positive

Name: Natalia D
Review: Very funny about the hammocks and the food was second to none... I ordered a 2-step menu that included fish with cabbage and a delicious sauce ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è... for dessert a cheesecake that was also very good... I would return
label: positive

Name: jeep_girl_00
Review:
A'Dam Lookout was highly recommended by both locals and friends who visited before us, and we're so glad we checked it out! Getting there was a breeze‚Äîwe took the free ferry behind Centraal Station, and it was just a few minutes' walk to the Lookout.

We purchased the tower and swing tickets, hopped in line, and enjoyed the light show in the elevator on the way up. The first level is packed with amenities: Ma'Dam restaurant and bar, washrooms, tiny lockers, and stairs leading to the top. Plus, you get an enclosed 360-degree view!

The top level is where the magic happens: a bar, smoking area, raised platforms for unobstructed photos, the iconic A'Dam sign, lounge pillows, and the SWING! 

We had gorgeous weather, making the swing experience even better. Before swinging, you can stash your items in a basket in front of your swing. The swing felt incredibly safe, and we soared out over the edge about 25-26 times‚Äîpure exhilaration! Don't forget to keep the QR code for your swing photos.

After the swing, we enjoyed delicious burgers and fries at the restaurant. The little tubes of mayo are a genius idea! We were lucky to snag seating with a view in the Ma'Dam corner.

All in all, we're really happy we did this experience. Highly recommend for an unforgettable Amsterdam adventure!
label: positive

Name: Sere
Review:
I had a day in Amsterdam and decided to check it out despite the very high price (‚Ç¨26 for going to the roof of the tower + doing a 1 minute experience on the swing) since I had read good reviews. Sadly, it's a tourist trap.

If you're looking to sit on the roof for the entire afternoon, then it might be worth it, as it's a nice enough environment, but if you're actually there for the view, there isn't much to see, as there is either a grate or glass and so you can't even take a good picture, and you pretty much see all there is to see in a couple of minutes.

The swing itself... It was going a bit too fast for my taste, so I didn't enjoy it as much. The staff was lovely (and the only reason why it's a 2 star review instead of 1 star), but the experience is really only good for Instagram, as they take some pictures of you.

The biggest rip-off is at the end: when you do the swing, they give you a piece of paper with a QR code. Before you leave, you scan it into a machine and you have the option to buy the photos: 3 printed photos for ‚Ç¨25 plus an additional ‚Ç¨5 if you also want to download the digital versions. The photos were cute so I bought them for ‚Ç¨25 (a HUGE amount for what they are), only to find out that... If you scan the QR code on your phone, you can actually download them for free! But oh no, they don't tell you this when you're there, which feels like a huge rip-off. I wouldn't recommend this at all!
label: neutral

Name: nadege d
Review: Impressive! A psychedelic elevator takes us to the top. A glass floor that impresses. Panoramic views of the city. Let's go up to the terrace. Pff, that's amazing! Go to the swing: moment both frightening and spectacular. But what idea to want to swing at 100 m high!? The whole city is spreading out at our feet. You can see the monuments of Amsterdam...
label: positive

Name: ELIZABETH D
Review: It was fantastic! The virtual reality roller-coaster is so cool. The swing is so awesome. The pictures are fantastic. Totally worth the price
label: positive

Name: Chris W
Review: You can't take your own camera for obvious reasons, but a full video and photos were taken. I wouldn't hesitate to go again. The only downside I can think of is that it feels like it's over too quickly.
label: positive

Name: taggeist
Review: Even when the weather wasn't brilliant blue, it was great! It was very windy, but very cool. The lift up to the top is worth the trip. Swing for the brave.
label: positive

Name: jhbjhb
Review: Quick service and friendly. Quick to get on the lifts. Nice view from the top. Very fun free boat ride from Central Station to get there which you can take bikes on and is very quick.
label: positive

Name: Annalisa P
Review: The view of the city is spectacular.  Danger lovers can experience the cute swing that swings you into the void! Or you can peacefully enjoy a drink!!!!
label: positive

Name: Timo
Review:
Very nice view of Amsterdam, the swinging was also cool, but very short.
No waiting time with the ticket purchased online. Getting there by tram and ferry was super easy.
label: positive

Name: A83
Review: As someone who doesn‚Äôt like heights I stupidly said yes to doing the swing once we got to the top we had quite a wait so definitely get there 15 minutes early if you are doing the swing. When it was our turn the instructor was super friendly and explained everything to make me feel better. I learnt that as long as I look outwards and not down then it was fine and I could enjoy the view! I would say that if you are going to come here and have a drink then use the downstairs bar and take the drinks up to the roof as they only had 4 options of drink on the roof and all of them I didn‚Äôt like so I went downstairs and got a martini for only ‚Ç¨6. The BR experience was alright and was good to do but it isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúmust do‚Äù whilst you are there
label: positive

Name: Ben White
Review:
We were so lucky to be blessed with a sunny day when we visited A'DAM Lookout.
There's a very short free ferry ride which leave every 15 minutes I believe, which goes from Centraal Station. Make sure you get on the one that says Veerkade Noord.
There was very short queue to get in and there's a pleasant suprise in the elevator, so if you're scared of elevators this should help. You get a fridge magnet included in your ticket price, there's a restaurant inside as well as a viewing platform which is inside and toilets.
We also paid to go on the swing which is a definite, if you're looking for an adrenaline rush and want to soak up a gorgeous view on Amsterdam. At the top, they have oversized beang bags and a bar so perfect to chill with friends and get drunk.
Overall, would highly recommend whether you want to do the swing or not.
label: positive

Name: Dan V
Review: Amazing views of Amsterdam. A very cool light show during the elevator ride up and down. To get to A‚Äôdam lookout, you take a free relaxing ferry ride. The price was worth the views. I went during the day, but I am sure it would be beautiful at night. I will do that the next time that I am in Amsterdam. There are plenty of other fun activities located around A‚Äôdam Tower.
label: positive

Name: Audrey G
Review: But what a view arriving on the panoramic roof... and then we finished with the sensational activity of the famous swing 100m high!!! Really great
label: positive

Name: Carsy18
Review:
Great fun. Walking up to the building was thinking it doesn‚Äôt look very high so can‚Äôt be that good! 
Soon as I first swung out I quickly realised it was more nerve racking than it looks from the bottom! 
Great views across the city and great fun on the swing with really friendly staff
label: positive

Name: KrazyKatlover
Review:
I booked here for my 50th birthday purely because I wanted to do something different other than just wander around‚Ä¶.and I‚Äôm so glad I did! 
Feeling hungover from the night before, we took a hassle free ferry over from Amsterdam Centraal and followed in the direction of the big tower! 
Barely any queues, we eased through with our QR codes and took a disco lift that took you up many floors in a blink of an eye! ( There is a green room set up on entry to have pictures took which are really well presented and are great memory keepsakes) 
And when we got to the very top‚Ä¶..WOW‚Ä¶..this was my very first visit to the Dam and what a focal point to see it all from. Views for miles and so many photos to take! 
I didn‚Äôt really know much to why this tower was here, but after watching videos and reading up, I see now this is the work of pure genius. Not only is it the best viewing platform to see the whole of  Amsterdam but it sports a hotel, a nightclub, a bar, an interactive games platform and a revolving restaurant‚Ä¶.it really ticks all boxes. 
With my entry that I pre booked weeks before online, I also added the ‚ÄúOver the Edge‚Äù swing experience‚Ä¶..I was hoping that my partner would be too jaded from the night before to go on it, but sadly not! I‚Äôm completely terrified of heights so cannot understand why I thought it would be a good thing to do??! But I did it, I nearly passed out on the damn thing through fear, but I‚Äôve kept every picture and video they recorded of us to prove I went on the highest swing in Europe‚Ä¶.even if it was the worst 2 mins of my life!!! 
So yes this is a must‚Ä¶..even if your eyes are closed through it!!! 
A well deserved birthday prosecco was needed in the Madam bar afterwords to calm my nerves and take in the wonder of Amsterdam. 
Following this I booked the VR  Rollercoaster experience which was great fun, an interactive ride through Amsterdam was different, exhilarating and I didn‚Äôt want it to end. 
There are ‚Äúinsta‚Äù photo opportunities galore in this place with a red horse and huge Adam sign to sit on right at the top, as well as the awesome views‚Ä¶.
We finished this off with a four course tasting lunch menu in the Moon revolving restaurant which was absolutely perfect in every way. I cannot think of a better way to celebrate my 50th with them memories forever locked in now. If you only have a few days in Amsterdam‚Ä¶.please pencil this in because you won‚Äôt be disappointed!
label: positive

Name: bebas90
Review: We discovered this attraction thanks to a boat tour because none of the friends we have despite having come to Amsterdam have ever been there or in any case did not know of its existence. The place is magnificent both during the day for the breathtaking view and in the evening to enjoy the sunset. The highest swing in Europe is a must do!!!
label: positive

Name: Olena B
Review: We had a beautiful sunny day,lots of photos and memories!!!Magnificent 360*degree views and 2 glasses of üçª on the rooftop bar!!!
label: positive

Name: Hilary T
Review: We had the iAmsterdam card which allowed us entry to the Lookout tower, we chose to do the swing for an extra 7.5 euros each. It was quite cold and rainy when we got there but it meant it wasn't busy (no queue) and the staff kindly let us on the swing early. We stayed for a couple of drinks in the bar as well and enjoyed some views across the city. We may not return unless we come back with friends but it is well worth a visit!
label: positive

Name: travelling-couple786
Review:
Over the edge swing was fab - we really enjoyed it (and the adrenaline rush!). We went around 1pm and it was pretty busy for the time but the staff run a smooth and efficient service so you get your turn pretty quickly. Staff also take pictures whilst you‚Äôre on the swing which you can purchase or download for free on to your phone via the ticket given to you. The viewpoint in general was nice and very relaxed atmosphere - there were lots of seating areas and you are able to purchase food/drink to enjoy on top. We had Iam city cards so the actual entry was free and we paid ‚Ç¨7.50 each for the swing which was great value, without the city card the entrance plus swing tickets add up to 25 euros or so each. 
Accessing Ad‚Äôam lookout was really straightforward - easy to get to central station via the tram or metro. Once you‚Äôre on the harbour there are regular ferries which you will need to board to go across to the other side of the harbour where Ad‚Äôam is located. The ferry is free and very regular. 
Overall, a definite must do whilst in Amsterdam and it‚Äôs something a little different from all the other attractions Amsterdam has to offer.
label: positive

Name: Emily
Review:
Amazing views of the city. Went in the early evening and wasn't too busy so was able to take some lovely pictures and take in the views. Might seem a bit pricey at first, but once you see the views and what is available up there to do - it is worth the money. Also gives a good history into Amsterdam and why they wanted to create the lookout experience
It was a little bit cold and windy being that high up - but still a lovely experience
label: positive

Name: anna
Review: This was my favourite activity whilst visiting Amsterdam. The views from the tower are amazing, we had some drinks at the top looking over the city. The swing is a must, you aren‚Äôt on it for long (less than 5mins) but was so fun and you get pictures taken and can download for free. We also did the virtual reality rollercoaster and recommend that for another fun experience.
label: positive

Name: Amy G
Review: They advertised the elevator as a spectacular light show. Going up 160 meters in 20 seconds that was very underwhelming. I went solo on the lookout swing it was an adrenaline rush. I was under the impression that you got a free digital memory but not so. so I purchased my photos. Plus a video
label: negative

Name: Mr L. F.
Review: Cool location, a bar inside and outside, prices for drinks are OK. The swing is not a must, but if you like you can book it on site. The view from above (about 100m) over Amsterdam is worth it...
label: neutral

Name: prettyvale
Review:
It was the last day and we didn't know what to do... then it occurred to us that we could take a swing ride at 100 meters above sea level, so we went to the central station and followed the signs for FERRY.
Once at the boarding point, take the F3 which will take you to the other side of the river in 5 minutes for free.

From there, the swing is immediately visible.
Entrance isn't cheap, but we've never had an experience like this before, so we went in

Entrance fee to go to the rooftop is ‚Ç¨18.50 each. Here you can see the view or have something at the bar.
Additional cost for swing ‚Ç¨7.50 each.
The tour lasts 1 minute and at the end we send you a link with photos that you can download for free. If you want them printed, there is an additional cost to pay.

For me all in all, recommended.
When you are on the swing, don't look down: I was out of breath ;)
label: negative

Name: Guste J
Review: Amazing experience. Definately recommend! Staff are so nice, the atmosphere is breathtaking. Spent the whole day there and would come back for more.
label: positive

Name: EllaC71
Review: Really enjoyed our recent visit to the A‚Äôdam Lookout. Great views and the swing was quite challenging for my husband who‚Äôs scared id heights but he did still enjoy it (once firmly on the ground üòÅ), Friendly staff and the bar food looked delicious.
label: positive

Name: Doreen H
Review: Fantastic view of the city. Yr experience starts in the elevator, which takes you up at speed! And has a light display, we didnt do these, but there is a swing that takes you out over the building, and a virtual ride.
label: positive

Name: Tariq Al
Review: Quit an amazing venture to oversee Amsterdam looking out to Central station and canals. Would even be better if you time your visit with sunset. In my case it was cloudy and rainy
label: positive

Name: paulojrmateus
Review:
Our experience at A'dam Lookout in Amsterdam was incredible! One of the city's most popular attractions, it offers stunning views of Amsterdam and its surroundings. From the top of the tower, we enjoy a 360-degree panoramic view of the city, including the famous canals, the rooftops of historic houses and iconic landmarks such as the Magere Brug Tower and the Anne Frank House and Central Station of course.
Then the "Over the Edge" swing, which hangs 100 meters high on the side of the tower, (the highest in Europe, they say) provides a unique adrenaline experience.
Don't forget the VR experience, the closest thing to a real roller coaster.
There is also a bar and restaurant on site where we can relax and enjoy a drink or a meal whilst admiring the scenery.
Overall, A'dam Lookout is definitely a worthwhile experience in Amsterdam, especially if you're a fan of panoramic views and thrills.
label: positive

Name: mayccm2018
Review: Convenient location - regular free ferry behind Central Station.   The VR ride was quite funny.   Around the city through roller-coaster.  Many famous places of Amsterdam could see through 360 degrees view.  The swing was amazing and exciting even little bit short.  Wonderful experience.   Definitely worth it.
label: positive

Name: Cesar T
Review: Excellent place to tour, pre-purchase your museum tickets with the audios to make the most of the tours. Get lost in the center walking, as well as in the trucks and metro (it is safe the city)...
label: positive

Name: GerardWals
Review: Fantastic view over Amsterdan today of the lookout. Then on the swing, what an experience!! Delicious Sandwich and Caesar salad and the vr ride done, what an experience on Thursday afternoon!
label: positive

Name: MartyParty4
Review: This was our first activity after arriving in Amsterdam. We took the free ferry over and it was an easy short walk to the tower. Once inside we purchased our ticket for the swing and we also booked This is Holland which is in the building behind Adam Tower. The lift to the top of the tower is filled with flashing lights as you go up. Once there you can see the views from the restaurant and go outside on the roof for the swing. If you are not swinging they have a platform set up to see out and also take photos of someone swinging. You can purchase the photos they take of you when you go back down to the gift shop. Great start to the trip.
label: positive

Name: Roberto Vinciguerra
Review: Abbiamo cenato in questo ristorante ma devo dire che le aspettiamo forse erano fin troppo alte ; siamo arrivati l√¨ alle 20:30 abbiamo cenato alle 22 , servizio intasato , ragazzi che si guardavano fra loro e giravano attorno ai tavoli senza concludere nulla ; per farsi perdonare ci hanno offerto un secondo bicchiere di vino che oltretutto non √® arrivato nemmeno in tempo . Peccato perch√© la location √® davvero carina e il cibo non √® male
label: negative

Name: Ida B
Review: We visited with our iamsterdam card, otherwise I‚Äôm not sure we would have visited. The view over Amsterdam was nice with tower viewers all around. I recommend going at sunset as it would make it more special. We didn‚Äôt try the swing or the restaurant/ bar which could have contributed to a more  spectacular experience.
label: neutral

Name: Mykola Turchyn
Review:
A‚Äôdam Lookout offers a truly inspiring panoramic view of Amsterdam from above ‚Äì perfect for photos and soaking in the city. The atmosphere is modern and chill, with a caf√© and lounge area available (booking a table in advance is recommended). Tickets are ‚Ç¨18 on-site or ‚Ç¨16 online, which feels a bit steep, but overall worth it.

You can ride the elevator to the rooftop for an amazing bird‚Äôs-eye perspective ‚Äì there‚Äôs also a swing ride for thrill-seekers (though I didn‚Äôt try it). Clean facilities, friendly staff, and a cool glass-walled toilet with a view add to the experience.

Would recommend, especially for first-time visitors.
label: positive

Name: Tony K
Review: We bought the combo ticket with This is Holland. The views are a must see. Great drinking and eating options or just see the sites! We only used the lookout. Plenty of photo opportunities, the swing looked fun for any thrill seekers (it is extra). We only went during the day, I wish we would have went back at night to see the city lit up as well. Warning, there isn't much sun protection while on the observation deck. Bring sunscreen! Overall we spent a little under an hour viewing the sites and taking great photos. Catching the ferry over is free, but can get busy with all the tourist and bikers.
label: positive

Name: CAG1
Review:
Took ferry over ( bonus as free ). On entry got the tokens for drink we paid for . Glad we didn‚Äôt choose food as so many places in Amsterdam but enjoyed the drink with view .

Great view . Lucky with a good summer‚Äôs day . Spent ages looking down . Lovely tourist attraction .
label: positive

Name: ranee6629
Review: The elevator was sooo cool and mom and I went in the Adam‚Äôs swim which was fun. Felt a like a real daredevil. Was an awesome experience.
label: positive

Name: anhorns
Review:
We jumped on the ferry from the central train station over to go visit A‚ÄôDAM.  
No lines, great view. We didn‚Äôt partake in the swing (chickens)
We enjoyed lunch and drinks, while overlooking the city of Amsterdam. 
I would recommend
label: positive

Name: CH200
Review: We LOVED our visit to the top of A'dam Tower. The swing was outstanding - very secure and well run. And, of couse, the view is incredible. We also enjoyed our break in the bar with excellent cocktails & food.
label: positive

Name: Michael U
Review: Just ten minutes from Centrum via ferry the A'DAM Lookout is an all-in-one hotel, overlook, bar, restaurant and amusement park.  Easy to access and navigate guests travel up 20 stories in an elevator with light-show before choosing a VR Rollercoaster, over-the-edge swing or dinner.  Touristy, with prices to match, staff is pleasant and everything is operated with safety and proficiency.
label: positive

Name: Eden263
Review: I always like to go up a tower, so I was looking forward to this! It wasn‚Äôt too busy, so there wasn‚Äôt much of a wait. The lift (elevator) has a fancy light thing in the ceiling, which is a bit of fun. The view from the top was great! It was very windy, of course, but you can look out from the windows in the bar if the wind is too much! There‚Äôs also a film showing the awesome firework and drone display from a New Year‚Äôs Eve, and another film telling the story of the tower‚Äôs history and how it came to be transformed into the multi-purpose entertainment centre it is today.
label: positive

Name: AliciaGaysonLawrence
Review: We booked the Lookout/Swing/VR Roller-coaster. Good price for the 3 if bought in a bundle. Lovely way to spend an afternoon
label: positive

Name: Louise l
Review: We visted Adams Lookout after This is Holland . We firstly had a VR ride on the roller coaster.  My daughter loved this but I wasn't impressed (not sure if faulty as it was very blurry). We then went up to the sky deck. Enjoyed a waffle and a drink, good atmosphere with the music playing. Decided to go on the swing which was a fab experience. The lift up and down was good fun with the lightshow. Great views for photos. Would recommend
label: positive

Name: Kaylee C
Review: The service here is incredible. They went above and beyond to accommodate for unforeseen circumstances. The staff are also very sweet and just the best.
label: positive

Name: L T
Review: Loved this! Best thing to do in Amsterdam after a canal boat trip. Brilliant views, the swings were great and the rollercoaster was amazing. Will definitely do it all again if I return to Amsterdam.
label: positive

Name: Petmo68
Review: My 10 yo son and I visited the ADAM Lookout and combined it with the VR Rollercoaster and Swing options.  The view from the observation deck is amazing (luckily we had a clear day).  To make the most of the time up there I do recommend that you combine it with the other activities that are available.  The VR roller-coaster was good and the Swing was brilliant - my only criticism would be that the swing ride wasn't long enough.  Overall, with the added activities, it was a good way to spend an hour or so
label: positive

Name: mmiceli86
Review:
The swing is an absolute blast! It‚Äôs thrilling without being too intimidating, and the VR experience adds an extra layer of fun. Plus, they provide free photos to download afterwards, so you can capture all the excitement without paying extra.

If you‚Äôre visiting Amsterdam, this is definitely a must-do activity for a memorable and fun experience!
label: positive

Name: Zap D
Review:
A'dam Lookout is an observation deck on a 100-metre high tower that allows you to enjoy spectacular, panoramic views of Amsterdam. Entry to the observation desk is free with the I amsterdam card, otherwise you'll have to pay ‚Ç¨16,50 for a standard adult ticket, which it is better to buy online as it's ‚Ç¨2 cheaper. If you'd like to get on the swing, you'll have to pay another ‚Ç¨7,50, and you can also get combination tickets which include food, drinks and a VR rollercoaster ride.

Although I really enjoyed this site, I wouldn't say that it's a must-see. However, if you've got some spare time and you enjoy city views, it's worth checking it out.
label: positive

Name: danielkooren2003
Review: A really nice experience! Staff are super friendly and the elevator up/down is really great. You really have the best view on clear days and you can really look around for hours! For the thrill fans there is a swing on the roof of the tower and you can do another VR roller coaster ride through Amsterdam. I did this with the Stadspas promotion, but the prices at the checkout are fine! Before or after your visit you can also check the shop for nice souvenirs / gadgets. I really come back more often!
label: positive

Name: 007-MMK
Review: Come and enjoy. You coud come with family or friends and you find something for everybody. VR experience, swing at a height of 100 m, top view and bar as well. So have you been here ?
label: positive

Name: Heather ü©∑
Review: We enjoyed this attraction the staff were friendly and  it doesn‚Äôt take long to do but we thought the views were lovely and highly recommend doing it when in Amsterdam.
label: positive

Name: Joshua T
Review: Really fun experience, we got great photos on the sky deck, the swing was fun (though a very short 90 second ride) and we also did the VR rollercoaster experience. The only thing that marred the experience was waiting around for 10 minutes for staff to sort out the lockers which didn‚Äôt open as intended using the website.
label: positive

Name: Maciek K
Review: Really worth going, amazing views of the city! The fee is very reasonable for what you get, I highly recommend the swings on the roof top! The staff is very friendly and happy to tell you about the city!
label: positive

Name: syl_via
Review: just entered the 360¬∫ sky deck with my "i amsterdam card" and find it rather boring, lucky i didn't specially purchase the ticket to visit. don't think it's a must visit in my opinion.
